summary:
JavaScript, often shortened to JS, is a popular programming language used to create interactive websites. It works with HTML and CSS to make web pages dynamic. Most websites use JavaScript to add features like animations and form validation.

Web browsers have a special program, called a JavaScript engine, to run this language. It can also be used in servers and other apps, with Node.js being a common choice. JavaScript is versatile, supporting different programming styles and providing tools for various tasks, but it doesn't handle certain tasks like graphics or networking on its own.
title: JavaScript
